48bc90e8-4abd-49a2-acd9-2a5c4a8bd2ff.description: This level of membership is awarded to learners studying towards a level three or higher qualification in the arena of international trade with the Institute of Export & International Trade, or the UK Customs Academy.

81933319-57d6-4362-b230-5c4bcc4f8ed8.description: Earners of the Customs Procedures & Documentation Training Course badge understand in depth the many aspects of customs documentation & the reasoning behind it. After completing this course, earners understand the role of UK tariff codes, proof of export, SAD C88, change from CHIEF to CDS, benefits of AEO, WTO methods of valuation, how to comply with rules of origin & preferences, relief schemes & customs notices. They are able to operate an effective & compliant customs documentation process.
81933319-57d6-4362-b230-5c4bcc4f8ed8.name: Customs Procedures & Documentation

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

67e1aad4-9e7e-4803-b86b-f6ac72123108.description: A Full Member has reached eminence in the course of their employment in international business or in overseas related trade through five years' or more experience in International Trade and/or completed a Level 5 or higher professional qualification with the Institute.
67e1aad4-9e7e-4803-b86b-f6ac72123108.name: Full Member

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Has five or more years' relevant experience in international trade or has completed a Level 5 or higher qualification with the Institute.

0a73ed52-b9d8-4592-b17d-d07e764363ae.description: Earners of the Introduction to Exporting Training Course badge understand the exporting procedures and documentation required to run a successful and efficient global business. After completing this course, earners understand the role of the tariff code, how to produce the necessary documentation for an international shipment, the basics of letters of credit, and the role of customs. They are now able to use export documentation and procedures to reduce business costs and increase sales.
0a73ed52-b9d8-4592-b17d-d07e764363ae.name: Introduction to Exporting Training Course

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend an Introduction to Exporting Course

ea1070f2-c9cf-40f7-ba29-b35f0373e8d8.description: Earners of the Advanced Exporting Training Course badge understand in depth the many aspects of international documentation, the reasoning behind the requirements and their content. After completing this course, earners understand the role of tariff codes, how to prove origin, proof of export to satisfy HMRC, methods of payment, how to comply with IPR and customs relief, benefits of AEO, and customs audits . They are now able to operate an effective and compliant export documentation process.
ea1070f2-c9cf-40f7-ba29-b35f0373e8d8.name: Advanced Exporting Training Course

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend an Advanced Exporting training course

9016f0b8-9421-4cee-9744-d4f94ef52428.description: Earners of the Completing Customs Declarations training course badge know how to complete customs declarations accurately and efficiently for both import and export of goods. After completing this course, earners understand how to compile a basic import / export entry, where to seek additional information, the penalties liable and how to avoid them, how to use CHIEF, other software and CDS. They are able to ensure declaration compliance.
9016f0b8-9421-4cee-9744-d4f94ef52428.name: Step by Step guidance on completing Customs Declarations

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

f69f6596-bb2f-4cd5-bf20-ae5a411aac2d.description: Earners of the Customs Classification & Tariff Codes training course badge understand in depth the commercial implications of the correct use of the Tariff/Commodity codes & the reasoning behind them. After completing this course, earners understand the role & structure of tariff codes, trade agreements, landed cost analysis, how to comply with Rules of Origin, export licences & are able to ensure declaration compliance. They are able to work out the costs of products in export markets.
f69f6596-bb2f-4cd5-bf20-ae5a411aac2d.name: Customs Classification and Tariff Codes

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a Customs Classification and Tariff Codes training course

112f4442-35d3-458f-a940-78cad09a5c9b.description: Earners of the this training course badge understand all aspects of Rules of Origin, trade agreements & how to comply with them. After completing this course, earners understand how tariff works, how trade agreements are negotiated, the interpretation of rules of origin, what is preferential & non-preferential trade, understand EUR1, ATR, GSP, and registered & approved exporter schemes . They are able to ensure that their business is more competitive in export markets.
112f4442-35d3-458f-a940-78cad09a5c9b.name: Understanding Rules of Origin, Free Trade Agreements & Export Preference

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

cd076cfa-9053-4afd-9b4a-ffd8a8f37f9b.description: Earners of the Introduction to Importing Training Course badge understand the importing procedures & documentation required to run a successful & efficient global business. After completing this course, earners understand the application & impact of Incoterms, role of import licences & tariff codes, payment security & letters of credit, temporary imports, duties to be paid, & the impact of Brexit on imports. They are now able to use the knowledge gained to reduce business costs & increase sales.
cd076cfa-9053-4afd-9b4a-ffd8a8f37f9b.name: Introduction to Importing Training Course

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

4aa0ffc3-449d-40e9-9695-4a0594270547.description: Earners of the Post-Brexit Documentation & Compliance training course badge understand how to ensure continuity of their export & import business in relation to trade between the UK & the EU & rest of the world. After completing this course, earners are able to ensure compliance with rules of origin, understand key documentation, product classification, WTO methods of valuation, GSP and benefits of AEO.
4aa0ffc3-449d-40e9-9695-4a0594270547.name: Post Brexit Documentation and Compliance

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

a3973b80-9312-4a38-b92b-1c9f4b1598b2.description: Earners of the Advanced Importing badge understand in depth the many aspects of compliance with customs duty relief schemes, customs & payment methods. After completing this course, earners understand the role & application of CPC codes, tariff quotas, Anti-Dumping Duties, duty suspension & reliefs, how to complete SAD C88, VAT Value Adjustments, benefits of AEO. They are now able to operate & effectively manage long-distance relationships & organise international transport & customs clearance.
a3973b80-9312-4a38-b92b-1c9f4b1598b2.name: Advanced Importing

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

8b0e17bf-c5ff-46b2-af5b-49001a979b5e.description: Earners of the Incoterms® Training Course badge can understand the functions, significance, features, obligations and responsibilities for each of the terms within Incoterms® 2020. They are now able to understand when and how to Use Incoterms® 2020 effectively, avoid uncertainty, minimise delay and facilitate smooth operations, transport and payment.
8b0e17bf-c5ff-46b2-af5b-49001a979b5e.name: Incoterms®2020

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

86f93f06-9b5f-4cb9-8ffa-a0e17a0a5e8e.description: This one-day training will focus on the requirements that businesses must now follow when trading goods with Europe, arising from the UK:EU Trade Cooperation Agreement (TCA). The course will cover the rules required for tariff free trade, requirement for customs declarations and how to trade successfully with your European customers.
86f93f06-9b5f-4cb9-8ffa-a0e17a0a5e8e.name: Trading with the EU

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend The Trading with the EU course.

a1d39dc9-eb7a-40d8-b8f4-b1b86910639d.description: Earners of the Introduction to Export Licensing Controls Training Course badge understand the exporting procedures and documentation required to export both military and dual-use goods plus software and technology. After completing this course, earners understand how to check and apply for an Export Licence, the types of export licences, the role of End user undertakings and EUGEAs, and get an overview of SPIRE. They are now able to ensure compliance with Export Control Organisation (ECO).
a1d39dc9-eb7a-40d8-b8f4-b1b86910639d.name: Introduction to Export Licensing Controls

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend an Introduction to Export Licensing Controls Training Course

a48e447c-3bbe-4506-acd0-1b93833fb13d.description: Earners of the VAT in International Trade course badge understand what is VAT, what is does and how to comply with the rules behind VAT. After completing this course, earners understand the EU VAT rates and thresholds, zero rates VAT invoices for exports, EC sales list, proof of exports, role of intrastat, VAT on services and digital services, UK & European VAT law. They are now able to ensure a compliant and effective export and import process.
a48e447c-3bbe-4506-acd0-1b93833fb13d.name: VAT in International Trade

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a VAT in International Trade training course

7e95812a-daac-47ec-945b-47eaf1ce4760.description: An advanced course instructing delegates in how to complete customs declarations and ensure customs compliance through the online Customs Handling of Import and Export Freight (CHIEF) and its replacement, the Customs Declaration Service (CDS). This course will explain the importance of import and export customs declarations and the completion rules under CHIEF. We will then compare using CHIEF to the changes which will occur with the implementation of the new CDS system.
7e95812a-daac-47ec-945b-47eaf1ce4760.name: Customs Declaration Services (CDS)

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

This course will explain the importance of import and export customs declarations and the completion rules under CHIEF. We will then compare using CHIEF to the changes which will occur with the implementation of the new CDS system.

46caf3ce-5dbf-469c-a91c-b13d664567f8.description: This membership level is only available to people with less than three years' experience in international trade. These members are dedicated to improving their knowledge and understanding of international trade, export management and administration.

ee3d1d3d-8a79-49b9-bb30-c1a112b20a78.description: Earners of the Award in Trade Finance badge are able to evaluate the impact of fluctuating exchange rates and how businesses should recognise and manage exchange rate risk, emphasise the benefits to exporters of using finance and insurance effectively in order to support the financial needs and create competitive advantage. They are able to evaluate the features applicable to medium and long term exports, along with the client needs of the exporter and overseas buyer.
ee3d1d3d-8a79-49b9-bb30-c1a112b20a78.name: Award in Trade Finance

e8619064-e049-4559-9935-22bc75b39256.description: Earners of the Excise Duties and Procedures training course badge understand in depth the indirect taxes applied on the sale of specific products & the reasoning behind them. After completing this course, earners understand the what goods are subject to excise duties, UK excise laws & controls, import and export procedures, EMCS, excise authorisations & guarantees, AWRS, calculation & tax type codes & how to complete excise returns. They are now able to manage risks and ensure compliance.
e8619064-e049-4559-9935-22bc75b39256.name: Excise Duties and Procedures

645216f2-8af3-48be-995a-e3ebe332398e.description: Earners of the UK & US Export Controls Training Course badge have a basic understanding of Export Controls & the implications of non-compliance. After completing this course, earners understand the application process & impact of export licences, international treaties, scope of EAR, the rating of military goods, dual use items, ITAR brokering, ECCN classification, & US Export Control Reform. They are now able to use the knowledge gained to reduce business risks & run a compliant export process.
645216f2-8af3-48be-995a-e3ebe332398e.name: UK & US Export Controls: A Basic Understanding

d71562a4-b369-4d0c-8af0-c7c333e0de09.description: Earners of the Level 4 Diploma in International Trade badge have a detailed knowledge of all the principles, procedures and documentation needed for a successful career in international trade. They understand the range of economic measures currently active in the UK economy, the main features of law relating to international trade, the financial risks attached, the regulatory framework behind the shipment of goods, and are able to apply current marketing theories to practice.
d71562a4-b369-4d0c-8af0-c7c333e0de09.name: Level 4 Diploma in International Trade

7ebe0bce-b66d-4603-8e7b-06d24d316265.description: Earners of the Post-Brexit Planning Workshop badge understand the implications for existing export & import businesses in relation to trade between the UK & the EU & rest of the world. After completing this course, earners are able to anticipate the future customs legislation, tariffs, understand the importance of WTO, implications on FTAs, evaluate transport & logistics issues, analyse & minimise risks. They now have the knowledge to prepare for different medium & longer term Brexit outcomes.

0f1f2958-82f0-4f8a-b735-fa3accac22cf.description: This course will evaluate trading arrangements for goods movements into and out of Northern Ireland. The implications of trading arrangements arising from the Northern Ireland Protocol and trade in 2021 are evaluated in terms of trade between Northern Ireland and either Great Britain, the European Union or the Rest of the World.

After completing this course, earners understand export & import processes, determination of commodity codes, use of Customs Procedure Codes, export & import controls, methods of valuation, how to comply with preferences and relief schemes. They are able to operate an effective & compliant customs documentation process.

a9812b5b-89c5-40a0-8e2e-4efad371d0b0.description: The Award in International Transport and Documentation qualification provides students with an understanding of the import and export order process from original enquiry, supply chain distribution to payment collection. In addition to considering the role of the freight forwarder and other trade intermediaries, it also covers the main methods of international transport and the documentation used in international trade, as well as the various trade terms and methods of payment.
a9812b5b-89c5-40a0-8e2e-4efad371d0b0.name: Award in International Transport & Documentation

da706879-5ded-4331-9358-4ff2c8bc18be.description: Earners of the New Computerised Transit System Training Course badge have an introduction into the Freight Transit regime and explanation of how to access and utilise the NCTS (New Computerised Transit System). Traders are introduced to the commercial advantages of the regime with basic step by step analysis of the system and regulations required by HMRC and UK Border Force to ensure compliance and facilitate smooth operation within the freight supply chain.

30e44237-f254-43a4-b190-9312302756e9.name: Customs Declaration Services Advanced

In this course we’ll explore how this differs from CHIEF.

b2a55b9f-a083-4d2a-91a4-ad9574e30684.description: Earners of the level 3 Customs Practitioner Award will have a comprehensive understanding of the core compliance areas; classification, origin, valuation, and import and export declaration procedures so that they will feel confident working in an international trade environment, with an understanding of the resources available to effectively manage customs risk.

3c84f2ac-63a8-46bb-9bcc-7050bb6c43f5.description: Earners of the Diploma in World Customs Compliance & Regulations badge understand in detail the procedures involved in dealing with trade from the UK to outside of the EU, UK to the EU, & customs procedures within the UK. They understand the structure of tariff & tariff controls, rules of origin, EU Preferential Trade Agreements, EU Customs Union, benefits of being AEO approved. They are able to efficiently declare goods to HMRC, identify & apply for export/import licences & reliefs.
3c84f2ac-63a8-46bb-9bcc-7050bb6c43f5.name: Diploma in World Customs Compliance and Regulations

After completing this course, earners understand the different types of letters of credit, the benefits to buyer and seller, roles and responsibilities, common documentation and terms, how to avoid discrepancies, and the role of banks. They are now able to use the knowledge gained to maximise business profitability & working capital.

7c30eacb-5581-4696-89f6-b8dc0b55064c.description: The first part of your ‘Step into International Trade’ programme is a two-day online training course running through the basics of exporting, importing, customs and logistics. ab873008-608f-40b1-b60a-c2a1aff6870d.description: Earners of the Certificate in International Trade badge have a good awareness of global trade issues and a clear understanding of the processes and practicalities of International Trade. They know the various techniques which a business may employ to move into an overseas market, the legal aspects of international business operations, understand the role and importance of Incoterms, the structure of the UK Balance of Payments, the operation of cargo and credit insurance policies.

badge_template_activities.title: Documentary requirements for composite goods and fish-related goods- Additional considerations and documentation for fish, organic goods and high-risk food not of animal-origin.Determining legal requirements when importing or exporting animal-origin products.Basic customs procedures and documentation- Working with intermediaries to meet SPS obligations- Importance of Incoterms to determine who is responsible for customs formalities.

e36594f7-2248-4eb3-b8fd-cc1605e201c6.description: Earners of theInternational Trade and Finance Training Course badge understand in detail the instruments of trade & payment performance required to ensure a successful & efficient trade performance. After completing this course, earners understand letters of credit, bonds & guarantees, credit referencing, how to comply with trade sanctions & anti-money laundering regulations, and mitigate risks. They are now able to use the knowledge gained to maximise business profitability & working capital.
e36594f7-2248-4eb3-b8fd-cc1605e201c6.name: International Trade and Finance

5e1ef853-4fcc-410f-befb-32b1fd3bf850.description: Earners of the Authorised Economic Operator training course badge understand in depth the AEO requirements & benefits that can be gained in achieving AEO status, and how to avoid delays & mistakes. After completing this course, earners understand the role of AEO in UK/EU, post-Brexit implications, AEO-C, AEO-S & benefits of each, application process, audits, C117, C118 applications and how to meet standards. They are able to to help your organisation achieve & crucially, maintain AEO status.

bdd4a69a-afc5-409f-8239-7c7263e80084.description: This level of membership is awarded to existing members who have made an exceptional contribution to the achievement of the Institute's principal aims. They have reached eminence in the course of their employment in international business or in overseas related trade and/or has made an outstanding contribution to the Institute either at national or regional level.

eb183fb6-2cf3-416c-8ae1-dc7445c4a567.description: The award in international trade finance qualification provides students with an understanding of the keys to profitability in their business, and the most appropriate sources of finance to maximise such profits. Students are also required to evaluate and attempt to reduce the various risks that are common to all international trade, including exchange risk and country and buyer credit risk and to choose and operate the most appropriate methods of payment.
eb183fb6-2cf3-416c-8ae1-dc7445c4a567.name: Award in International Trade Finance

62beacff-44c6-4c5d-8a5e-194a306e86e1.description: Earners of this badge will have covered all types of warehousing available in the UK which allow a suspension of import taxes, including customs warehousing, excise warehousing and temporary storage facilities, including the facilities differences, the benefits of each and what type of companies can operate each sort. Learning outcomes covered options available when operating such a facility, such as CFSP, EIDR and inventory linking. Finally, an overview of each application process was covered.
62beacff-44c6-4c5d-8a5e-194a306e86e1.name: Customs Warehousing, Excise Warehousing and Temporary Storage

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

Learning outcomes covered options available when operating such a facility, such as CFSP, EIDR and inventory linking. Finally, an overview of each application process was covered.

a578268f-dded-406d-b2ad-e14dc3c28a8f.description: An Associate Member is a professional in international trade compliance Applications are open to any person who has three or more years' relevant experience in compliance with export control and trade sanctions regulations.

234d7f80-97e5-48d1-8448-93c2ca49c24b.description: Those who attended this training are capable of understanding the role of the Export Control Joint Unit in the UK as well as learning about UK export control rules and licensing requirements. They can additionally appreciate the challenges US control rules pose whilst understanding the implications of ITAR and EAR in the US. Those who have completed this training have learned what compliance processes are necessary to have in place when considering UK and US Export Controls
234d7f80-97e5-48d1-8448-93c2ca49c24b.name: UK & US Export Controls Training

09f2c036-7783-436c-ad11-935957069381.description: Earners of the Level 3 Certificate in International Trade, Customs and Logistics will - Know the costs of transporting goods internationally and the key parties in an international trade transaction. Understand key customs and trade documentation. Know the different payment methods and terms of trade that apply in international trade Understand the operation of cargo and credit insurance policies Detail customs processes and procedures that apply for exporting and importing
09f2c036-7783-436c-ad11-935957069381.name: Certificate in International Trade, Customs and Logistics

2b18966f-8468-4a64-a094-0c8ef765e8da.description: Earners of the Effective Incoterms Training Course badge can understand the functions, significance, features, obligations and responsibilities for each of the 11 terms within Incoterms® 2010. They are now able to understand when and how to Use Incoterms® 2010 effectively, avoid uncertainty, minimise delay and facilitate smooth operations, transport and payment.

c364a2a8-dcd9-406c-83a4-418185484e0b.description: Earners of the Introduction to Sales and Marketing Training Course badge understand all the basic aspects of international marketing and how to develop and grow sales to new and existing export markets. They know how to approach a market and what needs to be considered as part of the export sales and marketing plan. They are now able to conduct business meetings, field visits, trade shows and missions.

fc503a2d-6ea4-427e-b8ab-bf1535e93cd2.description: Fundamentals of International Business gives an understanding of the different types of business and organisational structures necessary to undertake international trade. Students learn the various ways by which a business may enter foreign markets, how to describe the financial objectives of business, including identification of sources of finance and managing financial risk.
fc503a2d-6ea4-427e-b8ab-bf1535e93cd2.name: Level 3 Award in the Fundamentals of International Business

skills.name: Methods Of Payment In International Trade

62d36bc6-eabe-4efb-acdc-b51ac5b12c6d.description: This Award teaches the different modes of transport, including factors relating to the choice of transport, provides an understanding of the different Incoterms, and recommend the appropriate term for a company’s international business. Students learn to manage the administration of a company’s international trade, understand a range of documents and their functions, the need for correct packing and insurance of goods, and effective relationships with international service providers
62d36bc6-eabe-4efb-acdc-b51ac5b12c6d.name: Level 4 Award in International Physical Distribution

issuer.summary: issued by The Institute of Export & International Trade

entity.name: The Institute of Export & International Trade

badge_template_activities.title: Pass the assessment with the following criteria: Identify a range of documentary options for an exporter . Outline the customs processes required to export successfully. Discuss the relative commercial merits of various transport options . Outline the limitations associated with each mode of transport. Quantify the risks covered under each insurance option. Acknowledge the importance of adequate risk assessment . Outline the insurance claims process

Complete the learning outcomes for the award. Understand the regulatory framework behind the shipment of goods in international trade. Understand the range of options currently available for the transportation of goods internationally. Know the commercial insurance coverage available to international traders.

59bac0f6-71f0-411a-8b2b-2525e142908e.description: Earners of the FdA Professional Practice in International Trade badge are equipped with the skills & knowledge needed to ensure compliance & a high level of competency in international trade. They understand the key aspects of international trade, including trade compliance, marketing, logistics & law. They have developed key management skills, such as managing people & change management, as well as gaining a practical insight into how a business works.
59bac0f6-71f0-411a-8b2b-2525e142908e.name: FdA Professional Practice in International Trade (with Anglia Ruskin University)

6ac376af-33ae-40b5-be4f-91def13f416f.description: This award introduces the key concepts of managing a business involved in international trade. Students learn the basic elements of business planning, the marketing concept and the main elements of the marketing mix. Students understand key sources of information and data, and how to use, analyse and interpret in the form of spreadsheets. Students have knowledge of the basic elements of business finance, contract law and legal issues within business operations and understand INCOTERMS 2020
6ac376af-33ae-40b5-be4f-91def13f416f.name: Level 3 Award Introduction to International Trade Management

081c72a3-4489-448a-b65e-73e0e3ac4178.description: IOE&IT Accredited International Trade Consultants are recognised for their commitment to delivering exceptional service. They have reached eminence in the field through ten years' or more experience in international trade and adhere to the Institute's CPD programme - keeping abreast with both contemporary issues and disciplines specific to extend the knowledge of how trade works.

9fa9573b-2bf6-4dda-8e78-357cdaf8e0d6.description: The Internal Export Compliance Training is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the implementation and managing of a company Internal Compliance Program. This includes Company compliance, responsibility and best practice, awareness training of suspicions orders, implementation and management of screening and transaction procedures, red flag systems as well as using Denied Party Screening.
9fa9573b-2bf6-4dda-8e78-357cdaf8e0d6.name: Internal Export Compliance Training

d9f0cfb8-6b4e-473f-b803-8810e9d3e01f.description: Earners of the International Documentation & Customs Compliance Training Course badge understand in depth the many aspects of international documentation, the reasoning behind the requirements & their content. After completing this course, earners understand the role of tariff codes, how to prove origin, proof of export to satisfy HMRC, payment methods, how to comply with IPR & customs relief, & customs audits . They are now able to operate an effective & compliant export documentation process.
d9f0cfb8-6b4e-473f-b803-8810e9d3e01f.name: International Documentation & Customs Compliance

d00b5c54-86cc-4109-8e40-3eead4d63a79.description: Earners of the International Trade Documentation– going digital understand how to handle and benefit from new digital formats of international trade documentation. Following significant progress in other sectors, governments and intergovernmental organisations are putting significant effort into accelerating digitalisation in international trade. They are doing this by encouraging the adoption and legal recognition of electronic documentation around the world.

7b04f3ab-6afa-41fa-8a59-f31ea8bbac76.description: The Global Marketplace enable students to distinguish between developed and developing countries, identify the major religions and languages and main centres of population. Students will be able to identify the main trading blocs in global trade, describe the origins, objectives and future developments of the European Union. It will enable students to analyse the structure of the UK Balance of Payments, list the UK’s main export markets and explain the basic structure and function of the Interne
7b04f3ab-6afa-41fa-8a59-f31ea8bbac76.name: Level 3 Award The Global Marketplace

550dc7ec-2028-41f3-bb02-62fa1b1d7e60.description: Earners of the Level 5 Diploma in International Trade badge are able to manage the broader managerial aspects of International Trade & make the right decisions when problems arise. They understand the range of economic measures currently active in the UK economy and the main features of law relating to international trade. They are able to identify the motives & strategic decisions necessary for international marketing operations and the financial risks attached.

20d6aa3e-9c7f-4cfc-ad14-8be97f250193.description: Earners of the Online Customs Declaration Training Course badge understand how to complete customs declarations accurately and efficiently. 40f38ef3-57a1-4048-a06e-5234a95e9943.description: This course enables businesses to assess risks in the markets they trade with and how they can mitigate these risks through proper planning. It will focus on the key customs and trade processes that are most affected by regulatory changes, as well as those that may be used by businesses to navigate the changing trading landscape.
